3cDW6mD9sIfLTK6zg3aUnw.text: We were looking for a breakfast place close by and found this cafe. First time trying it and we were pleasantly surprised!! The place is well lit and has a very nice modern, yet homie decor. Seats and tables are comfortable and they don't have loud music playing (like many of the new trendy places) which was great because we could actually talk :-) The service was excellent. Our server was very friendly and polite. He kept checking on us. Great service! The coffee was delicious and strong- from a local coffee roaster-our server explained. I really liked that they have wooden sticks to stir your coffee- versus those plastic ones that are so bad for the environment. We ordered an omelette and French toast. They were both delicious and perfectly cooked. Every single ingredient was of excellent quality including the butter and oils used to cook (you can taste it). The potatoes had rosemary in them- which I really like. This will be our new breakfast place! Congratulations to the owners of having such a great restaurant with high quality food!

6cxf0c2yDI-lRtt72gN3Hw.text: I had the absolute pleasure of eating breakfast here today. It's a hidden little gem next to a dry cleaners. Driven by the place a million times but the only thing that stands out on this strip mall is the oversized dry cleaner signage.   One thing that is certain is this breakfast diner, if you want to call it a diner, the food completely stands out! Bacon cooked to perfection, coffee flavor on point, and the chef special which consisted of Cali chipotle Benedict was outstanding.   It's really an upscale breakfast eatery not a diner. The decor is higher end and menu is original not like your typical breakfast joint.   I think they may serve lunch but I didn't go beyond the breakfast menu. I'll be eating here at least once a week! And btw...say hi to the owners/chef, top notch folks!

gDbbySIaY-q0jDMz_DpUmg.text: I absolutely LOVE this little breakfast/lunch spot in Arcadia! It is in our neighborhood and absolutely delicious every time. It is not only massive, but packed full of delicious goodies like potatoes, eggs, bacon, and cheese with a homemade green salsa on the side. I'm pretty sure it weighs 10lbs so I could only finish half of it. I did contemplate suffering a serious food coma and eating it all because I didn't want to stop. I don't even have words to describe how good it is - you just have to see for yourself!  The service is super friendly, cozy ambiance, and I just love it. I will be back soon!

The butter was rock solid. Also asked for jam, which she brought.   The kids meal doesn't include a drink so tack in $3 for lemonade.   I'll definitely give it another try. Their avocado toast is perfect , the sunrise burrito is gigantic , their sandwiches are killer- especially "the chook". They are always friendly and they have never disappointed. Also, they have a dog friendly patio!

rrViCvIlybA4rMzmFuH0Rw.text: A fantastic brunch place. 4.5 I stayed in Pheonix for only a couple of days, but if I had to pick one breakfast/brunch place, I would come here.  1)  Delicious Coffee.  A brunch place without an amazing coffee ain't a good brunch place in my opinion.  2)  They have a pretty extensive unique menu for breakfast/brunch.  I ordered the Green Chilli bowl ($14) - Slow cooked pork, green chilli sauce, over easy egg, cotija, cilantro & pepitas with tortilla  It sounds like a lot is going on, right?  When I received the dish, I was shocked at how much pork meat it had.  Underneath the green sauce, there was so much meat that it was probably enough for two people to share.  If you are a heavy meat eater, go for it.  Really tender cooked pork pieces are drenched in delicious green chilli sauce.  My egg was perfectly cooked and tasted delicious with the meat.    It might be a bit too heavy for some people though considering it is for brunch.  I don't know how many people could finish the entire serving.  I kinda wish they gave us a smaller portion and mixed it with some other healthier veggie choices.  Excellent friendly service.

-lfOVesbwrqOHPvV4arn3Q.text: Decent food, spotty service  Not Recommended (read on...)  I was brunching today with friends, and we decided to visit 3on Smith Cafe, which we'd done several times. (I'm "Duke" of this place...) We arrived around 12:30 PM, and surprisingly the place wasn't crowed at all.  Food: There aren't many low-carb options here. I ordered the Green Cilli Bowl, which was very tasty. The pork was tender and flavorful, and the green chili sauce paired nicely. The egg was also a nice touch, along with pipits and a bit of cotija cheese.  I told the server, Adriel, that I needed to stay low-carb, and asked what I could substitute for the tortilla. He suggested several different breads, or a fruit cup. After I explained these options also had lots of carbs, he sort of gave up suggesting, and pointed to the "sides" on the menu. I decided to go with the sauteed mushrooms, which were good and not over-cooked.  Atmosphere: 3on Smith has a bit of personality, which is nice. The music can sometimes be a bit overbearing though.  Cost: A bit pricey at $14 for the Green Cilli Bowl.   But the surprise was the added $3 for the sauteed mushrooms! When I asked for a low-carb substitute for the tortilla, at no time did Adriel mention there would be an additional charge.  Service:  We were there for an hour and a half, and they never once stopped by to ask if I wanted my water refilled (I did).  When I got the bill, I asked the server about the added $3. He handed off to the manager, who explained the mushrooms cost more than the tortilla - which I totally understand. The issue is they never said there would be an additional charge for the "substitution". The manager dropped $1 off the price, which wasn't a resounding acknowledgement that maybe they should have handled this differently.  Overall: With so many other great places for brunch on the weekend I'm giving 3on Smith a "pass" for a while.

Now, I am not one to splurge on breakfast, but I am so glad I did. You can not go wrong with the queens breakfast. It's the most tasty English breakfast! Savory mushrooms that melt in your mouth. The location is in a strip mall, but those tend to be some of the best restaurants in my opinion.   I came in around 1:30 on a Tuesday so I was one of the few people there. Roberta sat me down and was very sweet and kind the entire time. I got the Green Chile Pork Bowl and it was AMAZINGGG. So many different flavors that all worked together so well. I wish I could come back and try the rest of the food.   Overall great experience!

5luDBQEZHX04D9gvyUMoIA.text: Amazing food and an attentive staff regardless if they are your server or not. They are willing to accommodate any special requests and it is a favorite breakfast/brunch spot for my fiance and I.

ZQCZvoDtvTT55h4_qElPgQ.text: I loved this place!! Wonderful food, great tea selection, and exceptional service from our server. Cannot wait to go back.

ZhJc-qxKhAa5DQblcdHgWQ.text: I found this place on a whim! I was looking for something quick and yummy and I found that here at The Smith. Place was small but super inviting when you're inside. I had the scramble which I was obsessed with. It was served in a HOT skillet and by hot I mean I have a scar on my arm. The reaper is also a great meal. It was cheap, quick, and delicious and I'll for sure be back!

RU0NFvkFwesYFQxlzH7a2Q.text: Super cute little cafe. Friendly staff,  and if you get a booth comfy seats. We had the caprese sandwich,  and the chicken chop salad...very yummy and fresh! As a treat we had their desert of the day, and a cup of coffee (nice and strong and not bitter!). I will definetly return when I area. Nice and relaxed lunch spot.

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The meringue was light and airy and lovely.
Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing desert of day. Meringue, with whipped cream accents and a drizzle of blueberries.

kwYbFt0ccK8_We3TsHPeTQ.text: Went to The Smith today after a 3 hour delay getting into Phoenix. It's a cute little quick-serve restaurant with delicious options. I ordered the avo smash which did not disappoint (I couldn't even finish it)! The avocado was fresh and the lemon added the right amount of tangy-ness to the dish.   I did not see one thing come out of the kitchen that didn't look delicious! I would definitely come back here for a quick bite.

oJG98cKZZ3T-ztQiDNqrxg.text: Great good, quick service, and perfect facelift for the old Acacia Cafe location. We had the Green Chili Pork bowl and the Hungryman's breakfast. At $15 for the Hungryman's breakfast, I'm convinced this is the deal of the century for AZ brunch. They aren't kidding when they say "mountain of bacon"--- and it's top notch bacon to boot. Sausage was phenomenal, and the poached eggs were some of the best we'd had. The potatoes weren't much to write home about, but that's partially because everything else stole the show. The Green Chili bowl was good too- but could have used a little more heat. All in all I would HIGHLY recommend. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iuUL-CKLmaFsSwKDPd_xaA.text: I had the Green Plate. AMAZING!! Hubby had the special breakfast sandy (grilled chicken, sausage, etc). All was absolutely amazing/yummy!

pk_ZP8kodhbyHix4CRqFsg.text: Loved this adorable place. The hostess was acting many roles and doing an amazing job. When I commented on this she mentioned a few people called out sick. While I noticed our food took some tile her attention to service made me still feel this is a 5 star place. The good was also great with big servings!

xT6Ca_f56Dc22Z_JrVnH2w.text: GREAT BRUNCH today!! Came in during a busy shift and we were greeted right away at the door. LOVE the remodel and the menu. It was very cozy but still trendy, and the menu really had an option for every taste. I had the green chili pork and my friend had the reaper. Both had GREAT flavor and were more than enough food for one :)  Jordan was our server and she was awesome! She was genuinely attentive and did a great job of anticipating our needs! SO GLAD to have this place around the corner!!

6xEWJoOHy5XN8zhybI5acA.text: Went in for breakfast. The wait staff was friendly enough. My friend said she was going to order The Smith Hash based on reviews. After receiving her food she never commented about her meal and she didn't finish it so I take that to mean it was nothing special. I had the BYO Omelet which was also nothing special and definitely overpriced. Some of the potatoes were so crispy that I somehow scratched the roof of my mouth.  It was nice to see some vegetarian and vegan options on the menu. $2 to substitute eggs for mushrooms seems overpriced.  Overall, ok food that I can get cheaper somewhere else. Not worth the price. I won't return.

I5eChI8Lr4QbIimPQPrPsA.text: I love this place! Impromptu brunch with my 19 month old  grandson and daughter in law. We were welcomed by the owners and immediately seated and a high chair was placed at the table. Blueberry French toast, avocado egg and toast and an omelette with cheddar spinach and tomatoes....crisp bacon... yummy potatoes ...who could ask for anything more? Did you say coffee? Endless cup hot and delish. Will miss this place

9VcMTio6clDtI9c8AudIAA.text: Awww yeah!  This place is my new favorite for brunch-healthy and indulgent options and both are done to perfection.

XQ6V4DvZGzichCjcnc4hlg.text: We tried this spot because of the great Yelp reviews. It didn't disappoint. The breakfast burrito is huge! Perfect to share with someone. The salsa verde was the best I've ever had. Food was fantastic. We will definitely be back the next time we are visiting the Phoenix area.

l7JjhqwBxVuBo3rjcF0UAA.text: We had the Queen Mother and the Breakfast Sammie.  The Queen Mother is a traditional English breakfast.  It was fantastic!  We discussed the intricacies of baked beans with one of the owners - American BB are sweetened while British are not.  Apparently The Smith went with baked beans canned in Ireland that have a little sugar in them in order to be closer to the American palate.  I would like to voice my support for British baked beans - 100% savory and no sugar :-)  Both items were delicious and the portions plentiful.  The service was very friendly.  We sat out on the patio, which continues to be dog friendly (the last establishment at this location also had a dog friendly policy).  The kitchen was a little slow to get the food out but not terribly slow.  The tables along the wall on the patio are arranged such that you will sit facing the wall, or with your back to the wall.  While this allowed for more customers, it also meant that if you want both parties to be in the shade (in early May) you should plan to finish your meal by 11.   As you can see by the rating we very much enjoyed our meal and will definitely be back.

H_z8te3Ajd52Jc11oNBpIw.text: Food  Service  Atmosphere  Almond milk latte   Food is fresh and delicious. The staff is friendly and attentive. Definitely a spot I will keep coming to over and over again.

OE5KOYBMuaQq2tjBoq-79Q.text: Wow! The Coconut Chia bowl is amazing! I have some food sensitivities and this was beyond expectations.   The sausage and potatoes should not be overlooked.   Great, friendly service and family owned! Love it!

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut Chia! Yum

rtaiER7FenT0aCZ7FVSKNQ.text: The restaurant's vibe is great, the food is amazing, only negative was the coffee. I have ordered a cappuccino and wasn't as expected. Other than that, it was great! I have ordered The Chook, and it was fabulous!

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chook. Fabulous

Rd1vzy6oocBhKXNUKBSO0A.text: 3 diners; myself (occasional vegan, lifetime vegetarian), my husband (vegan), my best friend (meat lover, egg hater). The menu was inclusive to our eating preferences but honestly the vegan plate was too green. It was healthy with the broccolini, spinach and mushroom but please, add a starch to make it filling. My husband ate 2 orders and left hungry. I ate an egg white omelette which was good but the home fries tasted like rosemary with rosemary and more rosemary. The winning dish was the green chile roasted pork. It looked amazing and per Val, it tasted even better! However it wasn't spicy as advertised on the menu.  The service was good, the coffee was good, the outdoor seating was nice.  I would go back. But next time I'd ask for a few substitutions to have the perfect meal. Home fries on the vegan plate (no rosemary), and ask for the avocado mash with cilantro, lime and salt for a guac feel. Pepitas are on everything and I liked it :)

Uxd2Tpq619syVB32ckXvMg.text: The food is over priced the staff was slow and acted like we were an inconvenience. This was a one and done place for me.

I9VWpJgN7yQ4cm1_6qWW2Q.text: Ended up at The Smith with my four kids while my wife was out of town on a girl's trip. It was busy, which is a good sign, but the wait wasn't to bad. We squeezed into a booth and after a seat switch got comfortable and perused the menu.  Kid number one order the Hungryman Breakfast. This was a plate of food that could have been split three or four ways. Really. Three eggs. A pile of sausage and bacon. Big pile of small cubed potatoes. Toast. And he ate it all. How it goes for a teenager. He gave it a big thumbs up, but now is in a food coma.  Kid number two ordered the Arcadia Sunrise, which is a burrito. It had egg, bacon, cheese and potatoes and was split into two big pieces. He ate half and said it was good, especially with a small dip into some ketchup.  Kid number three ordered the BYO Omelet with onions and spinach. She liked it, but thought too much spinach and not enough onions. Came with lots of potatoes too.  Kid number four order the Jr Noble French Toast. He really liked it and ate the whole serving. He is a super picky eater so that equates to a good review from an 8 year old.  I ordered the B&E Roll, which is a tasty breakfast sandwich. I did it without the bacon. I know, so un-American. Deal with it. And it still was good. Egg, cheese and pickled onions on a pretzel roll with potatoes.   Good breakfast has seemed to get pricey, but The Smith was no more expensive than similar breakfast places.   All in all we would go back!

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vzVvFbgzQ0V4sE8AfcqVtQ.text: Try to sit there in the morning so you can sit on the nice patio outside. Try the orange juice it's freshly squeezed.   The food portions are quite large but well done. Will be heading back very soon...

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Excellent service and amazing food.

PB8izdhEUpVssaSqVQ0gEw.text: Fresh food locally sourced great service music kind of loud for me in the morning.  I like the whole energy of the restaurant.  The food was delicious with lots flavor made well not sloppy.  The waitress (Jackie) asked my name and called me that the entire time like a professional!  Their coffee - passport coffee is amazing.  Tastes so good doesn't need sugar or cream.  Tasted great black.  Stop by give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green chili bowl yum spicy

MrpSbDYVAfRyYupJKkfTlw.text: Too expensive for breakfast and experience. Paid $17.00 all in for French Toast, egg, and iced tea. Food was nothing special...blueberry topping seemed canned. Ambience is "casual upscalish" . .. a few steps above fast food niceness...ala Matt's Big Breakfast. The staff, however, was very nice and attentive. It would be a good choice if you want or need to go to a "nice" place for breakfast and you're not particularly concerned about value.

SJbDUnIDNXR6INcYBuhZbQ.text: Adorable breakfast spot in a great location in Arcadia. The service couldn't have been friendlier. I ordered the avocado toast with an egg on top.   The toast was thick and delicious and there was sprinkled crumbled cheese over the avocado.   This would be a great brunch spot to ride bikes to!

3tRUsIR85gnxk06Dka0uZg.text: The Smith is my FAVORITE brunch spot in the valley! From the moment you walk in till the moment you walk out you are given the best service. The smells that come out of this place alone make you full! The food is absolutely delicious the avocado toast is a mound of mouthwatering deliciousness! The breakfast burrito is the size of an arm and the skillet meals are always filled to brim with more delicious creations from the open air kitchen! The coffee is always fresh no matter what time of day you get it! Come here hungry because you will be stuffed all week when you leave!

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RC5GE0anwJdrKF7elpJ6-Q.text: Got the avocado smash, wasn't that great. The avocados tasted old and they masked the taste with lemon and salt. The meals the other people ordered who I was with were just sub par as well. Cute environment, just not the greatest quality food. I'd reconsider my review all together if it were cheaper! But it's at a higher price point, not the best bang for your buck.

Q0EETEdMOxfyFmPpCN8BYQ.text: Can't believe I have yet to review this place. Easily my favorite breakfast spot in Phoenix. I've eaten here at least a dozen times and I usually get one of two things - the green chile pork or the smith hash. Both are fantastic and I struggle with the decision each time. The pork has some spice that will vary in its intensity from time to time, but my fiance (who doesn't do well with spicy) still orders it so it can't be that bad for those of you on the fence with spicy food. Service is always top notch and I can't recommend this place enough.

zPlFOmkVdmSh3sCo8BLbRQ.text: My new favorite place! We had the Monte Cristo, Reuben and Green Chili Stew - all were superb! And the darling little waitress was attentive, yet not annoying; pleasant but professional; and full of menu suggestions, that she had personally eaten! Breakfast and lunch only and well worth stopping by!

pcgBZc38HjuLTPoQ4dVYcg.text: Since I discovered this place a few months ago, I've held this place close to my heart. The staff is incredible, the daily specials are to die for, and the food is both amazing and consistent every time I come here for breakfast and lunch.  I've had breakfast and lunch at this place more than anywhere else in many years.   This place and its people have me hooked. It was love at first bite.

zA6i_1OqgBRrKmA83Efxnw.text: This has been a spot that I have wanted to try since first seeing it in the Phoenix New Times and the wife and I finally decided to see what all the hype was about. At first glance the ambiance was hipster and the staff was friendly. You order and pay when you walk in the door.  We ordered the hungryman breakfast for me and the tuna special sandwich for my wife. The breakfast did take some time to prepare and looked and tasted good but didn't seem to be enough on the plate to warrant $17 price tag. I did try the wife's sandwich and it was just average.   When I left I still was hungry and felt a little taken. The food was good but just felt that I overpaid for what I ordered. I knew that I could have gotten the same quality and better for less money so the value was not there for me.   Still I would recommend trying the Smith. The breakfast was good but still not sure what all the hype was about.

sTUO9_EvjMEwzRhewEsGgQ.text: Great breakfast spot! Would definitely come back here again to try the rest of the menu.  Cool little place with hearty breakfast. I had the Queen Mother and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone with a big appetite!   It had 2 eggs, Schreiner's sausage, baked beans, bacon, potatoes, grilled mushrooms, roasted tomatoes, and toast!   Everything was prepared well, seasoned, and it's a very generous portion.  This breakfast was the drooling face emoji for sure.  They try to source local ingredients, which is great and I think this place is a great addition to the neighborhood!   Not a whole lot of seating inside, but that shouldn't be a deciding factor for this place. The staff were friendly and present.   Can't wait to go back!

pbWm1toB9o9t7Zpwc4dOug.text: Good spot. The service wasn't awesome, but it was okay. The corned beef was good, though dry. It's dark and hot in there, or at least was the day I went. My friend has gone back several times. He loves that spicy scramble.

onVRB9zqb74XqARsRRNMYg.text: Really don't see how they have such great ratings. Maybe it's better when it's not delivery. My breakfast sandwich was sooo soggy and just not good in general, the potatoes were flavorless, the green chili bowl was sooo soupy and the pork as just gross.

KekP3upYaHrjAhkTF1fkBA.text: Staff is very attentive. My coffee cup was never empty for long (very important!). I decided to go with the BYO omelet and I'm so happy with my choice! Between the omelet, potatoes, and toast, it filled my entire plate!! Very nice outdoor seating area which is a perfect early morning spot before the day got really hot! They also let dogs outside on the patio!

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BYO omelet with wheat toast

yBnMwuTa3505JPs9_NeVbw.text: Ok, if pictures are worth a thousand words, what are these pictures worth on a Sunday Morning?!?!   A LOT!!!  Great food, great service and an awesome patio!!!  Breakfast, brunch or lunch, you've got to give it a try!!

Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nE29d4Zwt1Ij_6hFyfYonA.text: Came here on a weekday and loved the simple but classic cafe ambience. The cafe is run by Aussies with a "Brekkie" section of the menu that seems notorious for their flavorful twists on breakfast concoctions. I've been stalking them on Instagram and it looks like they kill it at their specials; walking in I was excited to hear what they have in current rotation, especially since they released a chorizo breakfast sandwich that's more than drool worthy, a few months back. The special did not disappoint! Dubbed the "Dr. Seuss Burrito", this whimsical beast of a burrito was chock full of eggs, potatoes, green chili pork, provolone - and topped with salsa verde and queso cotista. And the size?! This is where the term "burrito baby" originated. Here. This is where they make 'em! On top of this burrito baby, I also ordered a Chai Latte. (How my stomach didn't explode is still a mystery).They get their coffee supplied by Passport coffee, and I  indulged in that cup of Joe, sipping while writing down in my journal for a while. That's how you know it's good. Great ambience, great food, great lattes? Holy cow I'm in love.

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mQb30n3Tk9dBymm2PPTeAw.text: I work right across the street from here and when I forget my lunch this is my go-to place!!!  "The chook" sandwich is AMAZING. I've had it every time and I can't bring myself to get anything else. The bread is so fresh, the chicken is so tender, and the chipotle aioli has the perfect amount of kick without being spicy.   The same waitress is always there. I believe her name is Roberta. She is so kind and attentive and has the best attitude!!!!  It's a tad pricey, but great food, great service, great atmosphere!!!!

w9rdng_1v-89CMQ4VCCUnw.text: Just tried this spot the other day! I'm a huge fan of brunch (I think it's the most important meal of the day) and I was pleasantly surprised to find that this place has an amazing brunch!   I ordered the avocado toast. As an avid avocado enthusiast, I was impressed with the flavors and presentation. My friend ordered the pulled pork sandwich, which was good, when it was finally brought out (details below). The Smith has a lot of healthy options which is always a refreshing break from the Oreo-Red-Velvet-Caramel-Sugar-Pankcake places.   Only reason for not 4-5 stars was the service - not sure if it was just an off day, but my waiter/kitchen got my friends order wrong twice, and on the third time it was brought out cold. I totally understand that things happen, it's just that no one offered an apology or even acted like anything was wrong, and the waiter actually seemed annoyed with us for trying to get the correct order brought to our table. Hopefully next time it will be better!

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qwkbB6i-DeRwmk6xMUKFJQ.text: Went there today to try it out. The food was fresh and very good. Their corned beef was to die for.    The downfall is their seating. The chairs are super uncomfortable.    The staff was friendly but sure walked around a lot doing nothing and dropped four things in forty minutes which was very loud and scary.

1UxKzR8xjQZKxhIaPGYY5w.text: Though unassuming from the outside, Smith Cafe is a standout brunch spot with excellent food and fun trendy atmosphere. I tried the BLT and it was DELICIOUS, I will definitely be going back.

FcAA8HYgVgzWVf-YKo_ipQ.text: I had the Green Chili Bowel and it was amazing. Great blend of flavors and spices. You better have an appetite because this is one hearty dish. It really is enough to share. Just ask for an extra egg. I will be returning to this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Country feel with great service.

TV25Wb0iI3p9JmdPzX4ChA.text: Holy cow when I went looking for a breakfast place to sustain me for a long day of errands, paperwork, and bureaucracy, I picked The Smith on a whim. I didn't expect really nice staff that were joking with each other as the brunch rush started, the cute decor, or a plate of food bigger than my head!  And it wasn't even the biggest!  I never understood the difference between an American breakfast and breakfast from the U.K./Australia. I do now. Roasted tomatoes and mushrooms might sound weird, but trust me it's worth it! I thought I was in the mood for a big breakfast, but I have to take some home. When they say a mountain of bacon, believe me they mean it! I had the Queen's Plate (sans the beans cause I'm a wimp), and I wound up taking most of it home.   They even indulged (and maybe understood?) my sometimes absurd tea needs, and had a wonderful collection to choose from.  The Smith has definitely earned a repeat customer, and I can't wait to bring my parents here next time they visit!

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Queen&#39;s Plate (I think?) Bigger than my head and FANTASTIC. I&#39;ll be eating this bad boy for 2 days minimum.
Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Smith&#39;s menu. Lots of this sounds super yummy!

HxnLTIdzhztk24-HKPaTTA.text: Good portions of an awesome breakfast at a reasonable price. My girlfriend's avo smash must've been two whole avocados, need I say more? I had the Reaper, which was both massive and actually spicy, which I love and don't often find. All that in a cute little spot with great service.

fQ8C3qUWTEyZyBZUH5HUwA.text: If you haven't been, go NOW. I work across the street so I got to know the last owners pretty well. Nice guys with basic food. This place is COMPLETELY TRANSFORMED into great food and a fun atmosphere.   I was first introduced to Rosco through his other restaurant Base on Lincoln and 32nd. After my 10th time there he told me they were taking this place over and I was ecstatic. I've been around 5 times now and everything I've had is great. FYI - I don't check in at every place I go cause that would be super weird to me.   I recommend the Reaper Scramble, Green Chili Bowl, and the Chook. Since I've lived in the southwest for a long time, the food isn't as spicy as some places so don't worry. If you do want some extra heat, use "The Smith Oils" they have next to the back door.   Awesome pace and I'm really happy they are in Arcadia. Thanks guys.

photos.caption: Photo of 3on Smith Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Reaper Scramble. Amazing!!

JixnYJ2u7QKMHLnBbE9Hrg.text: Stopped here yesterday for a little breakfast. My breakfast is rarely fascinating. But this was a good stop glad I went here

4dDKToO3s-x4fTVpPMT62Q.text: I order "Have It Your Way" breakfast to go with pouched eggs with sour dough toast. The eggs were fixed perfectly and the bacon and toast were delicious. However, all of my potatoes were burnt. It put a damper on the entire breakfast.

fspFLXGboj4InKsTjcA4eg.text: I'm so in love with this little cafe. The staff here is extremely friendly and the restaurant is gorgeous. I was here for breakfast on Friday. I ordered The Smith Hash {House corned beef, roasted green chillies, country spuds, onion, an over easy egg & toast}. It was the perfect breakfast. Instead of the over easy egg, I opted for the sunny side up. The egg was perfectly executed. Needless to say. I was one happy camper.

24BGk75TmbzFbYN-0RW-1w.text: I was going to post a picture but I keep forgetting to take one lol. This 1 of 3 spots that I come for breakfast. And it's the one I frequent the most. Supper friendly staff. The food is AMAZING! I usually order what's on the big chalkboard last few weeks it's been these amazing potato's with chilly and bacon and onion and just a sprinkle of heaven. Bring your appetite. I've also had the cave man or hungry man platter. If you are a meat eater. This is a must. I had the meat sweats. Coffee is great. And I tried the Panda Expresso. I can remember the ingredients but I remember almond milk and sweet condensed milk. It tasted better as I drank more then sadness when I had no more.

B4z_pKFM2YLX2LhajROgpA.text: We went here on Saturday morning around 11:30 a.m and the place was packed. We waited for 15 minutes to get our seat. The crews are friendly and helpful.   Since, they were too busy that day, our order took a bit longer (30-40 minutes) before they served it.  I ordered "The Reaper Scramble" and the crew said that if I like hot and spicy food, then this is the perfect food for me.  When I got my food, I was dissapointed because it was not hot nor spicy at all. So I asked my friends to try it just to see if they have different opinion on my hot and spicy order and they we're dissapointed as well. To be fair, the  food was savoury and appetizing but it was not hot and spicy. I also ordered cappuccino and it was so good that I ordered 3 cups.  I gave 4 stars because there can be improve in their services and

ZNm2U_-HuGwPCuFJHgO8xQ.text: We shared the hungry man and it was enough food for three really. Great quality in the food the meats are clearly high grade. The space itself doesn't have a great flow or feel however the food is good and appears to be a good value. Great coffee as well small detail. We had great customer service here everyone was super friendly and accommodating I can only assume the douche bags who found these people to be rude have their own issues. No the menu is nothing like Acacia which is ok for us a person can only tolerate so many nuts and grains. I will say a few more sweet options might be nice on The Smiths menu but as for meaty and filling they got it covered!

wkSetVXkrZa-MUjkrOYhtg.text: Unassuming place tucked into Gaslight square. Friendly staff. Small patio. Okay it is based on one visit and one dish but the food sucks balls. Green Chili pork platter for breakfast . Geezus could you not find a cheaper cut of meat than that fat laden gristle you poured into my plate . Unspeakably subpar.

YsnCbL4swkuHn0hneX3mpQ.text: Arcadia has a hot new breakfast spot that is gonna have people lined up with lots of bored, screaming kids for brunch on a weekend not long from now.   The Smith's here.   I went to my normal breakfast spot, Acacia Cafe, and saw that it's been reborn as The Smith, under new ownership with a totally new but still very familiar menu loaded with really fresh, delicious and local offerings.   Homemade corned beef? Done.   French toast with Noble bread. It's here.   Not just breakfast, either. They have a very competent sandwich board also, on homemade sourdough bread.   Come in so you can say you've been here before the line is around the building. You'll still wait in it, but at least you'll have some good times to look back on, when things were easier and you were one of the few people who knew about this place for the two weeks before it blew up.

_NSzjCDgZ7tVW65QH2-SQg.text: Love this place! So homey, the service can sometimes be slow but be patient it's worth it! You can feel the care around you, the owners are usually there helping out.

t9lPzl8Gh5vBZNZoMqNYvw.text: Stopped for lunch on 10/23/17.  I had one of the BEST soups EVER.  Soup is one of my favorite foods & I'm a senior so I have tried many soups. Our wonderful server, Chase offered a sample of the soup since I was not familiar with it.  I was hooked!  I eventually asked to speak to the chef, Jose because I wanted to know how often it might be on the menu, etc.  Jose explained that it was a family recipe & that his soups would be available for 1 week & then a new one would be presented. I believe he called it "Pepitas". It had s tomato base with ground nuts (pepitas plus other nuts?). It also had delicious chorizo meatballs and was perfectly spiced with just the right amount of kick. I've been to the Smith several other times for brekkie & that would have had me coming back anyway, but now there's Jose's SOUP!  I'll be back this week to get more of the Pepitas & then I'll have to show up at least once per week thereafter, as I have no intention of missing out on Jose's next soup masterpiece!  And PS. How refreshing to have delightful time with Chase & Jose going above and beyond to make our visit unforgettable!

bets06_eMCXTXkq4bTQX0Q.text: Awesome food, great service, reasonably priced, but most importantly... GREAT COFFEE!

naRSu5vlEm8VmTtQMTr36A.text: My new favorite lunch spot! All of their food is delicious!! I've had all the salads and I still can't choose my favorite because they are all that good. The sandwiches are yummy and quite large. Also they serve breakfast ALL day.

Pf8i_V-CHGv7M_XcbzGF3A.text: Delicious food and amazing service! The owners are extremely friendly and hands on. Great neighborhood cafe!

S9rzvPUc_FfXEzIilzj2yQ.text: Great stop! Flew into Phoenix and stopped here for breakfast. Got the avocado toast and an almond milk latte- both great. Would definitely recommend this breakfast spot!

2ORZGC-sq0e8q23GYPhYkg.text: Good service - great food ! Fresh and well prepared .The CHOOK  may be the best chicken sandwich I've ever eaten .

ofUWJywknXCy1prUUvArwA.text: Great little breakfast/lunch cafe in Arcadia.  The atmosphere is clean and modern and the menu features many natural and organic options.  The French toast was insanely tasty- you have to try it!

81LmmGux59lvqBimno9bAA.text: We were disappointed to find that our favorites, lox and bagels and eggs Benedict,  were not on the menu.  Neither was the yummy tuna salad sandwich or the spinach salad.  I realize that new places want to update and offer new items, but many Acacia patrons went  there for our old favorites.  I wasn't attracted to any of the new items, so I ended up having eggs which were okay.  The person with me, who was disappointed there was no lox and bagel, had a sandwich.  She said it was okay.  I may call now and they to see if the menu changes, If not, I probably won't be going there as often as I did.
